topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1820463687253d500061d#post_55a1820463687253d500061d
Okay; dude you're comparing dark souls to CoD on the backend.

If you want to know why CoD is a piece of shit is that the actual programming that goes into the CoD is rehashed from older games which in turn in rehashed from older games.

From a technical standpoint you are literally buying a 12 year old game just with better models and animations.

The only actual effort they put into it is that every time they fuck up with launching their games they do the bare minimum work needed to get the game functioning.


To use an analogy CoD is like a pinto with a ferrari car shell slapped on top of it; sure it looks nice and it can run but it ain't worth the sticker price by a long shot so distant it exceeding orbital velocity.


. . . also don't get me started on the legitimately evil business practices they do to their employees; like making your workers work 80 hours a week with no overtime, then firing them when the project is done, file non-discolure agreements that if you file a lawsuit against them for lost wages you'll get reverse sued for breaking your contract; the list goes fucking on dude.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a1834d6368726a14000267#post_55a1834d6368726a14000267
I don't think CoD is bad, i think allot of gamers are pissed that the most popular genre is FPS Multiplayer, which is what CoD does best, hence why it's so popular,

Okay since I'm not getting through to you; there's been instances of the shitbag companies like activision or ea firing pregnant woman rather than giving them maternity leave.  The way they get around the law is that they hire them on short term contracts that they renew, but once the baby starts kicking that contract isn't getting renewed.

topics.body:
CoD isn't bad, the games are structurally sound on their own

But in the long term, it's just not good for the series if they're pumping out essentially the same game every year. It's a good game to play once. Not four times.

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55a186166368726a140005f4#post_55a186166368726a140005f4
Not really actually; the sales have dropped over 60% over the past five years.  The sales dropped, if I remember correctly, around the 20% mark last year.

Basically sales are falling so fast that I *HIGHLY* doubt the series will be around for much longer.

I think the CoD series peaked at World at War and Modern Warfare games. Ghost and Advance Warfare looked _meh_ to me.
